results.title: Marketing: distribution strategy
results.creator_credit: Dallas County Community College and Paul Bosner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Business file.”.
Alex Burton questions Professors John Coyle and Donald Bowersox on product distribution as part of the marketing mix. Distribution is defined as putting the right product in the right place at the right time in the right quantity and is essential in the provision of customer service. Simple and complex distribution channels are described, some involving many “middle men” and some involving only the supplier and the customer. The managing director of Celestial Seasonings then describes the problems of distribution and how he has solved them.

results.title: Marketing wool (Wool marketing in the 1950s)
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Corporation and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Shows the various phases in handling wool from the time it is pressed into bales at the shearing shed until it is dispatched overseas. The wool auction system is illustrated and the point made that wool growers do not have any control over the price their wool brings at auction.

results.title: Marketing the myths
results.brief_description: This film is a presentation of the best of four hundred television commercials submitted in a competition. Aims to assist in the study of television advertising and its influence on modern society and culture.

group_works.title: It's all right, it's only a customer

results.title: Marketing in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
An account of the competition (suitably cut-throat) in the shaving market over the past few years. taking part are the top marketing men of the razor-blade and electric shaver industries. Wet versus dry, stainless verus non-stainless, Davids versus Goliaths. They form an ideal framework for an introduction to modern marketing in action.

results.title: Market town
results.brief_description: A film about market day in an old Nottinghamshire town. The roads leading to the town are full of traffic, for the country people are bringing their cattle, poultry, fruit and vegetables and other farm produce to market. At the market, farmers show each other sample of grain, crowd the cattle market, and sit about talking of the weather and the prices of the crops - the subject farmers everywhere talk about.
